intro: Phlegmariurus mooreanus, commonly known as the Moorean haircap, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, wiry stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a thick layer of papillae. This moss typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. It is native to New Zealand and is often found in areas with high humidity and moderate temperatures. The plant plays a crucial role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its natural habitat.
